div.p: Greetings. I have received the booklet on the deeds of the Turks, most esteemed sir, for which I thank you. Besides what I wrote to you and to Mr. Gwalther a few days ago, I now have almost nothing to add. The Gothic war seems to be nurturing a monster, as I have long since indicated to you. The Saxon and the papists are pressing it the most; but while the others pretend to engage in it more than they actually do, they indeed make a move, but achieve nothing. It will be very difficult, if not impossible, for the Spaniard to lead soldiers from Germany into Belgium. Farewell.
Your most devoted, Georg von Stetten.
To the venerable, pious, and learned man, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, the most faithful Antistes of the Zurich church, his esteemed [hidden] lord and friend in Zurich.
